item.title: Activision is shutting down Call of Duty: Warzone Mobile
item.content:encoded:
Together, we power an unparalleled network of 220+ online properties covering 10,000+ granular topics, serving an audience of 50+ million professionals with original, objective content from trusted sources. We help you gain critical insights and make more informed decisions across your business priorities.

This site is operated by a business or businesses owned by Informa PLC and all copyright resides with them. Informa PLC's registered office is 5 Howick Place, London SW1P 1WG. Registered in England and Wales. Number 8860726.

Chris Kerr,

Senior Editor, News, GameDeveloper.com

February 17, 2026

1 Min Read

Newsbrief: Activision is shutting down Call of Duty: Warzone Mobile on April 17, 2026, after the shooter fell short of expectations. 

The title had already effectively been laid to rest after being pulled from stores in May 2025. At the same time, Activision confirmed it would be ending support in the form of seasonal content, social features, gameplay updates, and in-app purchases using in real currency. 

Warzone Mobile launched in March 2024 for iOS and Android after a number of delays. According to PocketGamer.biz, it garnered 50 million pre-registrations prior to launch but has evidently failed to retain the interest of players.

About the Author

Senior Editor, News, GameDeveloper.com

Game Developer news editor Chris Kerr is an award-winning reporter with over a decade of experience in the game industry. His byline has appeared in notable print and digital publications including Edge, Stuff, Wireframe, International Business Times, and PocketGamer.biz. Throughout his career, Chris has covered major industry events including GDC, PAX Australia, Gamescom, Paris Games Week, and Develop Brighton. 

Daily news, dev blogs, and stories from Game Developer straight to your inbox
